etymologies: early 19th century (as noun in the sense ‘a twitching or jerking motion’): perhaps a blend of twitch or twist and jerk; in modern sense probably influenced by work

definitions: dance to popular music in a sexually provocative manner involving thrusting hip movements and a low, squatting stance

examples.text: just wait till they catch their daughters twerking to this song
twerk it girl, work it girl

shortDefinitions: dance to popular music in sexually provocative manner

definitions: a dance or dance move involving thrusting hip movements and a low, squatting stance

examples.text: between flaunting their curves and doing a little twerk here and there, the dancers' rendition of the video was quite impressive

shortDefinitions: dance or dance move involving thrusting hip movements
